intro: Brachystelma setosum, commonly known as the hairy stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, characterized by its fleshy leaves and colorful flowers. The plant has thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. Its leaves are typically covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Brachystelma setosum produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring.
